member.summary: Defines a command binding.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.CommandRouting.InterceptsCommandRouting
member.summary: If true, prevents Visual Studio commands to be routed to the active command target and instead causes raw WPF input to be routed to the element itself. Otherwise, commands executed in the Shell will follow their regular routing process.
member.remarks: This property affects behavior only when the owning element has keyboard focus.

member.summary: The command used to duplicate the current selection without touching the clipboard.

member.summary: Moves the caret to the next error or highlighted region.

member.summary: Moves the caret to the next error or highlighted region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.EditorConstants.EditorCommandID.RemoveLastSecondaryCaret
member.summary: Treats the primary caret as the first in a wrap-around search through the view, and removes the last one. This will either be the caret immediately before the primary one if the primary is not the first in the document, or it will be the secondary caret in the document if the primary is first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.EditorConstants.EditorCommandID.MoveLastCaretDown
member.summary: This combines the behaviors of insert next matching caret, and remove last secondary caret. The last secondary caret is defined as in in . It is then moved so it will be where would insert a new caret.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.OptionDescriptions.SettingNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to define the name an option is persisted with.
member.remarks: If null, then the option is persisted using the description's Name attribute.

member.summary: Names of the standard options pages.
member.remarks: Options with a Parent of one of these pages will be placed on the appropriate page.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.OptionDescriptions.XmlNameAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to define the name used to export/import the file from a .vssettings file.
member.remarks: If null, then the description's name is used as the xml name.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.FontsAndColorsCategory
member.summary: Represents a fonts and colors category. Font and color categories act as a mean to group various editors into groups that share the same colors. Examples of this in Visual Studio are "Text Editor", "Output Window", etc. These show up in the Tools -> Options -> Fonts & Colors dialog in the "Show settings for" drop down. This is an immutable class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IIntellicodeQuickReplace
member.summary: Definition of a MEF export to allow an extension to add a button to the QuickFind.
member.remarks: The extension needs to export an instance of IIntellicodeFindReplace. If there is no IIntellicodeQuickReplace2, then quick replace behaves normally. If there's more than one, MEF decides which one is used.

member.returns: UIElement displayed to the left of the Replace box in replace in files.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow
member.summary: An built around a difference between two files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.DifferenceViewer
member.summary: The used by this code window.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.Control
member.summary: The that contains the difference view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.Caption
member.summary: The caption for the diff window's document tab..

remarks.para: If null or empty, the default ("{0} vs. {1}") is used.
The caption is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.Tooltip
member.summary: The tooltip for the diff window's document tab..

remarks.para: If null or empty, the default tooltip is used.
The caption is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.LeftLabel
member.summary: The label displayed above the left view.

remarks.para: This object is displayed in a .
If the object is a string, then the string is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).
This label is not displayed in the side by side view if this.SideBySideLabel is not null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.RightLabel
member.summary: The label displayed above the right view.

remarks.para: This object is displayed in a .
If the object is a string, then the string is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).
This label is not displayed in the side by side view if this.SideBySideLabel is not null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.InlineLabel
member.summary: The label displayed above the inline view.

remarks.para: This object is displayed in a .
If the object is a string, then the string is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow.SideBySideLabel
member.summary: The label displayed above the side by side.

remarks.para: This object is displayed in a .
If the object is a string, then the string is formated (replacing {0} with the name of the left file and {1} with the name of the right file).
This label is only displayed in the side by side view and, if it is not null, the left and right labels will not be displayed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2
member.summary: An that can support a difference view. If a is specified, the code window will display the differences between the baseline and the buffer. Otherwise, the code window just displays the buffer.
member.remarks: This interface is provisional and may change in subsequent releases of VS.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2.SupportsDiff
member.summary: True if the code window supports setting the baseline. If false, will be null and attempting to set it will throw an .

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2.Baseline
member.summary: The baseline used for the computing differences. Can be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2.DifferenceBuffer
member.summary: The difference buffer used by the and (if it exists).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2.PrimaryDifferenceViewer
member.summary: The difference viewer for the primary view code window. Will be null unless is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow2.SecondaryDifferenceViewer
member.summary: The difference viewer for the secondary view code window. Will be null unless is true and the code window has been split.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindowFactoryService
member.summary: A factory service for creating difference code windows on arbitrary strings or snapshot spans.

member.summary: Create and showing the differences between to strings or SnapshotSpans.

Name of the file displayed in the difference viewer's RightView.

Options for the creation of the difference code window.

remarks.para: The can specify multiple roles separated by commas.

member.param: The buffer for the left side.
The buffer for the right side.
The s that will be added to the three views of the difference viewer.
member.returns: An that displays the differences between and .

remarks.para: The can specify multiple roles separated by commas.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceLegendElementProvider
member.summary: Creates that is displayed in the legend margin of the difference code window.

remarks.para:
This is a MEF Component and can be exported as follows:
[Export(typeof(IVsDifferenceLegendElementFactory))] [Name(...)] [Replaces(...)] [Order(After = ..., Before = ...)] [TextViewRole(...)]
The [Replaces(...)] attribute is optional. If specified, it indicates that this provider replaces the specified provider.
The legend elements are only displayed if the property of the right view contains one or more of the roles specified by the TextViewRole attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceLegendElementProvider.CreateLegendElement(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsDifferenceCodeWindow)
member.summary: Create a that will be displayed in the legend of the difference code window.
member.param: Code window in which the legend will be displayed.
member.returns: A to display or null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.DifferencePackageElements
member.summary: These are the default elements of the difference code window legend. Use the names below if you want to replace one of the default elements with a customized element.

remarks.para: These elements are displayed in the following order: RemovedLine RemovedWord AddedLine AddedWord HelpLink

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.DifferencePackageOptions.ShowLegendName
member.summary: Name of the option that controls whether or not the legend is shown in the diff view.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.DifferencePackageOptions.ShowLegendId
member.summary: Key of the option that controls whether or not the legend is shown in the diff view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsEditorAdaptersFactoryService.GetDataBuffer(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextBuffer)
member.summary: Get the DataBuffer of an IVsTextBuffer adapter (this is the top buffer of the data model buffer graph). This buffer will be the same as the DocumentBuffer except in BufferCoordinator scenarios.
member.param: The text buffer adapter of interest.
member.returns: Null if this method is called before content has been established for the adapter, otherwise the DataBuffer that is presented to the view model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsEditorAdaptersFactoryService.GetDocumentBuffer(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextBuffer)
member.summary: Get the DocumentBuffer of an IVsTextBuffer adapter (this is the bottom buffer of the data model buffer graph). This buffer will be the same as the DataBuffer except in BufferCoordinator scenarios.
member.param: The text buffer adapter of interest.
member.returns: Null if this method is called before content has been established for the adapter, otherwise the DocumentBuffer that is presented to the view model.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsEditorAdaptersFactoryService.GetWpfTextView(Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextManager.Interop.IVsTextView)
member.summary: Get the WpfTextView of an IVsTextView adapter.
member.param: The text view adapter of interest.
member.returns: Null if this method is called before content has been established for the adapter, null if does not implement IVsUserData, otherwise the IWpfTextView that presents the text in the UI.

member.returns: Null if this method is called before content has been established for the adapter, null if does not implement IVsUserData, otherwise the IWpfTextViewHost that presents the text in the UI.

member.summary: Get the IVsTextBuffer adapter for this text buffer (if it exists).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Editor.IVsTextViewCreationListener
member.summary: A listener for when a text view adapter () is created and initialized that has matching roles and was created over a text data model having a matching content type. Exporters must specify at least one ContentTypeAttribute and one TextViewRole, and should mark their export using the following attribute: [Export(typeof(IVsTextViewCreationListener))], along with [ContentType] and [TextViewRole].

member.param: The newly created and initialized text view adapter.
